slides.title: Wikipedia articles related to sustainability
slides.text: By following links to other Wikipedia articles from the "see also" section of the article on Sustainability we get a network of related articles.

slides.title: Full network
slides.text: By following the links from the "see also" of all the articles related to sustainability (i.e. two iterations) we get the following network. You can explore it like any other network: Look for communities of related articles, look for the bridges between communities of articles, or look for the articles receiving the most links.

slides.title: Community on circular econonomy
slides.text: Mouse over the nodes to explore. Zoom by scrolling.

slides.title: Community on green transport and mobility
slides.text: Mouse over the nodes to explore. Zoom by scrolling.

slides.title: Community on extinction
slides.text: Mouse over the nodes to explore. Zoom by scrolling.

slides.title: Community on evolution
slides.text: Mouse over the nodes to explore. Zoom by scrolling.

slides.title: Community on architecture
slides.text: These are all examples. Find more communities yourself. What do these communities tell us?

slides.title: Central bridging node on permaculture
slides.text: It is not just the article on sustainability that appear central in this network. Why?

slides.title: Central bridging node on peak oil
slides.text: Find more bridging nodes yourself. Why are they in between communities?
